articleinfo.title: Handbok för Gnometris

abstract.para: Gnometris is GNOME's version of Tetris, the classic game of interlocking four-piece blocks. As they fall from the top, the player must orient them to fit the other blocks at the bottom so that they form a complete horizontal line, in which case that line disappears and the player gains points.

sect1.title: Introduktion
sect1.para: Gnometris comes from the classic falling-block game, Tetris. The goal of the game is to create complete horizontal lines of blocks, which will disappear. The blocks come in seven different shapes made from four blocks each: one straight, two L-shaped, one square, and two S-shaped. The blocks fall from the top center of the screen in a random order. You rotate the blocks and move them across the screen to drop them in complete lines. You score by dropping blocks fast and completing lines. As your score gets higher, you level up and the blocks fall faster.
To run Gnometris, select ApplicationsGamesGnometris, or type gnometris in the command line.
Gnometris är inkluderat i paketet gnome-games, som är en del av skrivbordsmiljön GNOME. Det här dokumentet beskriver version 2.8 av Gnometris.

sect1.title: Spela Gnometris
sect1.para: You can score through two actions: completing lines and dropping blocks quickly.

sect2.title: Flytta klossarna
sect2.para: To play the game, you only need the four arrow keys.

listitem.para: Left and Right move the block correspondingly across the screen.
Up rotates the block. The default rotation is counterclockwise. You can change the rotation under SettingsPreferences and deselecting Rotate blocks counterclockwise.
Down and the Space Bar move the block down the screen faster.Down moves the block down faster. Space-bar moves the block directly to the bottom.

sect2.title: Starta ett nytt spel
sect2.para: To begin a new game, go to GameNew Game. The game will begin dropping blocks from the center of the top of the window. The default start-up of the game has no blocks in the game window and shows the next block that will fall in the upper right hand corner. Score shows the number of points you have earned. Lines shows the number of lines you have completed. Level shows the level of difficulty you are on.

sect2.title: Pausa spelet
sect2.para: To pause your game, go to GamePause Game. You can only pause a game when you are playing. The time limit on pausing your game is unlimited. To unpause the game, go back to GamePause Game.

sect2.title: Avsluta spelet
sect2.para: Go to GameEnd Game to end your current game without quiting Gnometris.

sect2.title: Quiting the Gnometris
sect2.para: To completely quit Gnometris go to GameQuit. If you are in the middle of a game when you quit, you will end your game without saving your score.

sect2.title: Hur man får poäng
sect2.para: You score points through two methods: dropping blocks faster and deleting complete lines of blocks. When you delete lines, you get more points, but dropping blocks faster will quickly add up. As you level up, the blocks will begin falling faster. The highest level is 10, at which point you will only have just over a second to manipulate each block.

sect2.title: Viewing Past Scores
sect2.para: You can view the top ten scores played on your computer through GameScores. The names of the users are shown next the their score and the date they played.

sect2.title: Anpassa spelets uppstart
sect2.para: By going to SettingsPreferences, you can customize a variety of features for the start-up of each Gnometris game: number and density of pre-filled rows, and starting level. "Pre-filled rows" refers to how many rows will already have blocks in them when you start each new game.

sect3.title: Antal förifyllda rader
sect3.para: You can change the number of rows that already have blocks at the start-up of each new game by using the spin box. You can start with up to 19 rows pre-filled at the start-up of your game. The default number of pre-filled rows is zero.

sect3.title: Densitet för förifyllda rader
sect3.para: You can change the density of the blocks in the pre-filled rows at the start-up of each game. You can choose a density up to 10 blocks. You should first choose how many rows you want pre-filled under Number of Pre-filled Rows. The default density of blocks is three.

sect3.title: Startnivå
sect3.para: You can adjust the level of difficulty you start on. The highest level you can start on is 10, which is the highest level you can play to. The default starting level is one.

sect2.title: Customizing the Gameplay
sect2.para: From SettingsPreferences, you can customize a variety of features related to the blocks: previewing the next block, block colors, and block rotation.

sect3.title: Aktivera ljud
sect3.para: Turn the sound effects on and off using this option. If you are playing this game in any area which you share with other people, you should probably select off.

sect3.title: Förhandsgranska nästa kloss
sect3.para: Choose this option if you want to see the next block that is going to fall. This feature helps you plan the placement of your blocks.

sect3.title: Använd slumpmässiga klossfärger
sect3.para: Choose if you want the various block configurations to be color coded or randomly colored. If you use the colors to help you identify blocks, random colors will make the game more difficult.

sect3.title: Bastard Mode
sect3.para: Choose this option if you want to select mode that is designed specifically to annoy the player. With this feature enabled, you never get the piece you want, and very seldom complete a row. Next block preview doesn't correspond to actual piece you get next, but to the one you probably wish to get.

sect3.title: Rotera klossar moturs
sect3.para: Choose this option if you want the blocks to rotate counterclockwise or not.

sect3.title: Visa var klossen kommer att landa
sect3.para: If this feature is used a grey image of the block will show you where the block will land. This feature is very useful for beginning players, but experienced players will find it a distraction.

sect2.title: Anpassa utseendet för Gnometris
sect2.para: Under SettingsPreferences, you can customize the look of Gnometris: images for the blocks.

sect3.title: Klossbild
sect3.para: You can change the style of the blocks, including image and size. There are a variety of pre-made styles.

sect3.title: Bakgrund
sect3.para: If you drag your favorite image into the Gnometris window it will be used as the background. If you want a solid color as the background drag one in from either the color picker or from nautlilus' Backgrounds and Emblems dialog (the reset item from that dialog also works).

sect1.title: Upphovsmän
sect1.para: Gnometris was written by J. Marcin Gorycki in 1999 and maintained by Gnome Games Team since then. This manual was written by Angela Boyle. To report a bug or make a suggestion regarding this application or this manual, follow the directions in this document.
